body_html:
"conda create -n tensorflow python=3.5" also works for me~
I've installed Anaconda 4.3.1 with python 3.6 and following the guidance from
https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_windows#common_installation_problems to install tensorflow with it and meeting the "not supported wheel" problem.
I just deactivate the former conda environment and remove it with:
"deactivate tensorflow"
"conda env remove -n tensorflow"
And then repeating the guidance with additional "python=3.5" after the creating cmd fixed the problem
"conda create -n tensorflow python=3.5" has downloaded and installed python3.5 to this new environment~
body_text:
"conda create -n tensorflow  python=3.5"  also works for me~
I've installed Anaconda 4.3.1 with python 3.6 and following the guidance from
https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_windows#common_installation_problems to install tensorflow with it and meeting the "not supported wheel" problem.
I just deactivate the former conda environment and remove it with:
"deactivate tensorflow"
"conda env remove -n tensorflow"
And then repeating the guidance with additional "python=3.5" after the creating cmd fixed the problem
"conda create -n tensorflow  python=3.5" has downloaded and installed python3.5 to this new environment~
body:
"conda create -n tensorflow  python=3.5"  also works for me~
I've installed Anaconda 4.3.1 with python 3.6 and following the guidance from 
[https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_windows#common_installation_problems](url) to install tensorflow with it and meeting the "not supported wheel" problem. 
I just deactivate the former conda environment and remove it with:
"deactivate tensorflow"
"conda env remove -n tensorflow"
And then repeating the guidance with additional "python=3.5" after the creating cmd fixed the problem
 "conda create -n tensorflow  python=3.5" has downloaded and installed python3.5 to this new environment~
